description.narrative: 8.1 UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively design and manage programmes, which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 8. Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

sector.narrative: PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 8.1 UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively design and manage programmes

description.narrative: UNICEF Zambia continued to improve systems and procedures to ensure effective programme planning, coordination, monitoring and evaluation. The 2019/20 Rolling Work Plans, which included the HACT plans and Integrated Monitoring, Evaluation and Research Plan (IMERP) were quality assured and finalised within set timelines. The quality score achieved was 77%, an increase from 66% in 2018. The CO adopted all five e-tools modules with 100% implementation rate of partnership management. The HACT plan implementation rate stood at 122% as at 30 December 2019. A total of 11 (against a target of 6) joint and multi-sectoral programme monitoring missions were conducted. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
